reviews.text: I stayed 1 night at the Hotel in May 2006, and found it to be a solid choice. It was clean, close to a variety of sights in the city with a helpful staff.
reviews.title: Solid find

reviews.text: It is hard to know what the hype is about it being an "eco hotel." Maybe keeping the room "card key" in the slot inside the room (which keeps the lights/TV/AC going) cuts down on wasted utilities, but I did not see much to differentiate the hotel from others.
reviews.title: above average
No complaints here...
reviews.text: The downsides: not very close to a metro stop (mayby a 10 mintue walk from the Duomo stop...don't take the Missori stop, because although maybe a bit closer, it is less of a direct route and more difficult to find), and I seemed to hear my people in nearby rooms walking in their rooms more than in other hotels. Otherwise the hotel was quite, clean and had a nice modern feel to it with new bathrooms.

likes.disliked: — tiny rooms, staff who doesn't care, window that doesn't close properly. I didn't feel safe nor well in my bedroom.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we were here on business purposes, we had 2 singles rooms booked. My room was just 6 m2, it was so tiny, with a tiny bed close to the wall, i could see the light from the corridor when lying on my bed, there was no place at all in the bathroom... i just hated the place.
reviews.title: Dishonest dodgy staff

reviews.text: In addition, the window was not closing properly (even if closed, if you pulled hard the window would open) and last but not least, there was NO hot water one morning !

reviews.text: I called the reception, they told me they would send someone to my room to check the water but no one came... i don't have 15 min to wait for the staff before going to work ! Especially when you have to walk 5 stairs because the small elevators are full.

reviews.text: We stayed at Ariston for 3 nights in May. The rooms were very clean and friendly service. We were coming in by train from Switzerland and the hotel was very easy to find by public transportation. This hotel is in heart of major attractions and walking distance. We also saw some celebrities staying at this hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic location, great staff

likes.disliked: — No late night food venues nearby

reviews.text: Stayed at Ariston through an Expedia package. Fantastic location, they are not lying, it is literally 5 mins to the Duomo. Clean modern rooms and bathrooms, quiet air conditioning. Nothing fancy, but everything you need. Green tea toothpaste!
reviews.title: Good location, budget hotel

reviews.text: Breakfast is simple, but tasty and fresh.
reviews.title: excellent budget choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was the least appealing of the four hotels I booked while traveling in Italy (the other hotels being in Venice, Florence and Cinque Terre).
reviews.title: Good Location, OK Hotel

likes.disliked: — It's located on a busy, noisy street

reviews.text: The location, while a comfortable stroll to the Duomo and other sites, is located on a noisy, busy street. The hotel floor plan is situated so that all of the rooms are effected by the street noise; the kind staff offered to change our room, but none of the others we looked at seemed any better. The room itself was moderate in size with furniture that' was a bit nicked and scratched-up; it had large windows overlooking the very busy street below. When the windows were closed, the room was relatively quiet. We were caught in the "it's too late in the fall to have the a/c on" season (city government imposed) so we stuck in earplugs and left the windows open. We found it interesting that even in this eco-friendly "green" hotel, we smelled cigarette smoke while passing a few rooms, even though it's not allowed.
reviews.title: Fantastic Location

reviews.text: The breakfast served was quite good. The modern/minimalist decor of the hotel makes it seem kind of cold in nature- not charming in the least. Hotels can be quite expensive in Milan, so maybe this is the quality level that can be expected at this price.
reviews.title: Good location, clean room, aircon

reviews.text: We did like exploring Milan: touring the Duomo, shopping in the Galleria, window shopping on upscale Montenapoleone and La Scala streets and dining outside in pedestrian-friendly Via Dante by the Sforza Castle.
reviews.title: Not bad Rooms, great location

likes.disliked: — very basic rooms and over priced

reviews.text: I stayed at Ariston from 2-8 Nov 2006 and i had a brilliant time in Milan.
reviews.title: Great location
